title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 26 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 26.

questions.question: How old was Uzziah when he became king of Judah?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:1 states that Uzziah was sixteen years old when he was made king.

questions.question: Who was Uzziah's father?
questions.explanation: The chapter mentions Uzziah was made king in the room of his father Amaziah (2 Chronicles 26:1).

questions.question: What city did Uzziah build and restore to Judah?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:2 says Uzziah built Eloth and restored it to Judah.

questions.question: For how many years did Uzziah reign in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states Uzziah reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What was the name of Uzziah's mother?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:3 mentions that Uzziah's mother was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 26, whom did Uzziah seek in his days?
options: God in the days of Zechariah
questions.correctAnswer: God in the days of Zechariah
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states Uzziah sought God in the days of Zechariah, who understood God's visions.

questions.question: Which enemy's walls did Uzziah break down?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:6 says Uzziah went to war against the Philistines and broke down the walls of Gath, Jabneh, and Ashdod.

questions.question: Who gave gifts to Uzziah as a sign of his strength?
questions.explanation: Verse 8 records that the Ammonites gave gifts to Uzziah as his name spread abroad.

questions.question: What kind of structures did Uzziah build in Jerusalem?
options: Towers at the corner gate and valley gate
questions.correctAnswer: Towers at the corner gate and valley gate
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:9 states Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, valley gate, and turning of the wall.

questions.question: Which activity did Uzziah love that involved wells, cattle, and husbandmen?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:10 says Uzziah loved husbandry and dug many wells for his cattle and farmers.

questions.question: True or False: Uzziah's army had three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred men.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:13 confirms the army numbered 300,000 + 7,500 men.

questions.question: True or False: Uzziah built engines on towers to shoot arrows and great stones.
questions.explanation: Verse 15 tells that Uzziah made engines on towers to shoot arrows and stones.

questions.question: True or False: Uzziah burned incense in the temple without any opposition.
questions.explanation: Verses 16-18 show Uzziah was opposed by priests for burning incense, which was not his role.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Then Uzziah was wroth, and had a ______ in his hand to burn incense.'
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:19 says Uzziah had a censer in his hand while burning incense.

questions.question: What was the consequence for Uzziah after he burned incense in the temple?
options: He was given gifts by the priests
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 state that leprosy appeared on Uzziah's forehead and he was thrust out of the temple.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 26 teach us about the importance of seeking God for success in life and work?
options: Seeking God leads to prosperity and strength
Success comes only from personal effort
We should rely on human wisdom alone
questions.correctAnswer: Seeking God leads to prosperity and strength
questions.explanation: Uzziah sought God and God made him prosper (2 Chronicles 26:5). His strength and success were due to God's help (26:7, 26:15). This shows the importance of trusting God for success.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to take on roles or tasks reserved for others in the church. Based on 2 Chronicles 26, what biblical principle would you share about humility and obedience?
options: Respect God’s appointed roles and do not overstep boundaries
It’s acceptable to do anything if you feel called
Leaders can do any task regardless of rules
questions.correctAnswer: Respect God’s appointed roles and do not overstep boundaries
questions.explanation: Uzziah transgressed by burning incense, a duty for priests alone, and was punished (26:16-18, 26:20). Respecting God’s order reflects humility and obedience.

questions.question: How does the example of Uzziah’s pride and downfall in 2 Chronicles 26 teach about humility and contentment?
options: Pride leads to destruction and God’s judgment
Pride is a sign of strength and blessing
God favors those who exalt themselves
questions.correctAnswer: Pride leads to destruction and God’s judgment
questions.explanation: When Uzziah became strong, his heart was lifted up leading to transgression and leprosy (26:16-19). This shows the danger of pride and the need for humility.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 26 teach about the role of godly counsel and correction in a believer’s life?
options: Godly leaders should confront sin and call for repentance
Sin should be ignored to keep peace
Correction is unnecessary if the person is powerful
questions.correctAnswer: Godly leaders should confront sin and call for repentance
questions.explanation: Azariah the priest and eighty priests confronted Uzziah and told him to leave the sanctuary because he trespassed (26:17-18). This shows the importance of godly correction.

questions.question: How does Uzziah’s dedication to building and strengthening cities and defenses reflect biblical principles of stewardship and work ethic?
options: Diligent work and wise stewardship honor God and benefit the community
Work is meaningless in God’s eyes
One should not invest in the land
questions.correctAnswer: Diligent work and wise stewardship honor God and benefit the community
questions.explanation: Uzziah built towers, dug wells, and strengthened cities (26:9-10), demonstrating faithful stewardship and a strong work ethic that contributed to the nation’s security.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with pride after experiencing success. Based on 2 Chronicles 26, what biblical truth would you share to encourage humility?
options: Success can lead to pride, but pride leads to downfall and separation from God
Pride is a sign of God’s favor
questions.correctAnswer: Success can lead to pride, but pride leads to downfall and separation from God
questions.explanation: Uzziah’s pride after becoming strong led to his transgression and leprosy, cutting him off from the temple (26:16, 26:20-21). This warns against pride and calls for humility.

questions.question: True or False: Uzziah’s reign was marked by his seeking God, which led to his prosperity and military success.
questions.explanation: Uzziah sought God and God made him prosper, helping him defeat enemies and strengthen his kingdom (26:5-8, 26:15).

questions.question: True or False: Uzziah was allowed by the priests to burn incense because he was the king.
questions.explanation: The priests opposed Uzziah burning incense because it was not his role but the priests' duty, and his disobedience led to his punishment (26:17-18, 26:20).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Uzziah’s mother’s name was ________, and she was from Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: The text states that Uzziah’s mother was Jecoliah of Jerusalem (26:3). This shows attention to family background in leadership.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 26 show the importance of family in leadership and governance?
options: Uzziah’s son Jotham took over leadership when Uzziah was cut off due to leprosy
Family has no role in leadership
Leadership is only by election, never by family
questions.correctAnswer: Uzziah’s son Jotham took over leadership when Uzziah was cut off due to leprosy
questions.explanation: When Uzziah was a leper, Jotham his son governed the land (26:21, 26:23), showing the biblical principle of family responsibility in leadership.

questions.question: What does Uzziah’s preparation of weapons and military organization teach about serving others and responsible stewardship?
options: Proper preparation and provision protect and serve the community
Weapons are only for personal gain
Military strength is irrelevant to stewardship
questions.correctAnswer: Proper preparation and provision protect and serve the community
questions.explanation: Uzziah prepared shields, spears, helmets, and engines for defense (26:14-15), demonstrating responsible stewardship and care for the people’s safety.

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 26, what lesson can be drawn about the consequences of disobedience to God’s commands?
options: Disobedience leads to judgment and loss of God’s favor
questions.correctAnswer: Disobedience leads to judgment and loss of God’s favor
questions.explanation: Uzziah’s disobedience in burning incense brought leprosy and separation from the temple (26:16-21), illustrating serious consequences of sin.

questions.question: How does the example of Uzziah’s long reign and devotion to God encourage perseverance through trials?
options: Faithful seeking of God leads to long-term blessing despite trials
Trials mean God has abandoned you
Reigning long is only by human strength
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful seeking of God leads to long-term blessing despite trials
questions.explanation: Uzziah reigned 52 years and prospered as long as he sought God (26:3, 26:5), showing the value of perseverance in faith despite difficulties.

questions.question: What does Uzziah’s work in agriculture and husbandry teach about godly stewardship and contentment?
options: Loving husbandry reflects stewardship of God’s provision and contentment
questions.correctAnswer: Loving husbandry reflects stewardship of God’s provision and contentment
questions.explanation: Uzziah loved husbandry and had many cattle and vine dressers (26:10), demonstrating faithful care for God’s creation and provision.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 26 teach about the importance of prayer and spiritual guidance in leadership?
options: Seeking God’s guidance through prayer leads to prosperity and wise decisions
Prayer is only private and not for leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Seeking God’s guidance through prayer leads to prosperity and wise decisions
questions.explanation: Uzziah sought God in the days of Zechariah who understood visions of God, and as long as he sought God, he prospered (26:5).

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 26.

questions.question: At what age did Uzziah begin to reign as king of Judah according to 2 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:3 states that Uzziah was sixteen years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: Which city did Uzziah rebuild and restore to Judah after the death of his father Amaziah?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:2 records that Uzziah built Eloth and restored it to Judah after his father's death.

questions.question: Who was Uzziah's mother as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 26?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:3 identifies Uzziah's mother as Jecoliah of Jerusalem.

questions.question: Which prophet is credited with writing the acts of Uzziah according to this chapter?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:22 states that Isaiah son of Amoz wrote the rest of the acts of Uzziah.

questions.question: What was the consequence of Uzziah's act of burning incense in the temple?
options: He was praised by the priests
He was made king of Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:19-20 explains that when Uzziah burned incense, leprosy appeared on his forehead and he was thrust out.

questions.question: What military advancements did Uzziah make to Jerusalem's defenses?
options: Built towers at the corner gate, valley gate, and turning of the wall
Built a moat around the city
questions.correctAnswer: Built towers at the corner gate, valley gate, and turning of the wall
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:9 describes Uzziah building towers at key gates to fortify Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 26, what activity did Uzziah love which contributed to his prosperity?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:10 states that Uzziah loved husbandry and had many cattle and vine dressers.

questions.question: True or False: Uzziah's name became well known even to the entrance of Egypt because of his military strength and prosperity.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:8 notes that Uzziah's name spread abroad even to the entering in of Egypt due to his strength.

questions.question: Who opposed Uzziah when he attempted to burn incense in the temple?
options: Azariah the priest and eighty valiant priests
questions.correctAnswer: Azariah the priest and eighty valiant priests
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:17 states that Azariah along with eighty priests opposed Uzziah's unauthorized temple act.

questions.question: What was the role of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler in Uzziah's military organization?
options: They were responsible for the numbering and organizing of the fighting men
They served as Uzziah’s personal guards
questions.correctAnswer: They were responsible for the numbering and organizing of the fighting men
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:11 explains that the fighting men were numbered by the hand of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler.

questions.question: How many mighty men of valour were the chiefs over the army under Uzziah?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:12 records that there were 2,600 chiefs of the fathers of the mighty men of valour.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Uzziah made in Jerusalem __________ invented by cunning men to shoot arrows and great stones from the towers.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:15 states that Uzziah made engines, invented by cunning men, to be on the towers and bulwarks for shooting arrows and stones.

questions.question: What leadership role did Jotham, Uzziah’s son, assume after Uzziah was struck with leprosy?
options: He was over the king’s house, judging the people
questions.correctAnswer: He was over the king’s house, judging the people
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:21 indicates that Jotham was over the king's house and judged the people during Uzziah’s leprosy.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Uzziah’s leprosy in this chapter?
options: It symbolizes divine judgment for his unfaithfulness and presumption
It was a physical punishment unrelated to his actions
It was a sign of his sanctification
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes divine judgment for his unfaithfulness and presumption
questions.explanation: Verse 16 and following show his pride and transgression led to leprosy, symbolizing judgment for his overreach into priestly duties.

questions.question: How does Uzziah’s seeking God in the days of Zechariah relate to his prosperity?
options: God made him to prosper as long as he sought the LORD
His prosperity was unrelated to seeking God
He sought God but was not blessed
questions.correctAnswer: God made him to prosper as long as he sought the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:5 states that as long as Uzziah sought God during Zechariah’s time, God prospered him.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: At what age did Uzziah begin to reign as king of Judah?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:3 states that Uzziah began to reign at sixteen years old, showing God’s providence in early leadership, consistent with other young leaders like Josiah (2 Kings 22:1).

questions.question: How long did Uzziah reign in Jerusalem according to the text?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:3 notes Uzziah reigned for fifty-two years, a long reign reflecting God's blessing upon his leadership, comparable to David’s reign length (1 Kings 2:11).

questions.question: What was the name of Uzziah's mother?
questions.explanation: The text in 2 Chronicles 26:3 provides Uzziah’s mother’s name as Jecoliah, highlighting the biblical practice of recording genealogies and family lines important to divine covenant promises (Matthew 1:3-6).

questions.question: How did Uzziah live in relation to God's standards during the early part of his reign?
options: He did what was right in the sight of the LORD
He did evil and forsook God
He was indifferent to God's commands
questions.correctAnswer: He did what was right in the sight of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:4 affirms Uzziah’s righteous conduct, echoing the biblical theme that obedience to God brings blessing (Deuteronomy 28:1-2).

questions.question: Who was the spiritual advisor that Uzziah sought God with, according to the chapter?
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states Uzziah sought God in the days of Zechariah, who understood God’s visions, illustrating the role of prophetic guidance in godly leadership (1 Samuel 9:9).

questions.question: Against which people did Uzziah wage war and break down walls?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:6 describes Uzziah’s military campaign against the Philistines, demonstrating God’s empowerment for defense of His people (Judges 3:31).

questions.question: What was the result of Uzziah’s military and political strength?
options: His name spread abroad even to Egypt
He lost favor with the people
questions.correctAnswer: His name spread abroad even to Egypt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:8 shows Uzziah’s renown extended to Egypt, underscoring the biblical principle that God exalts those who seek Him (Psalm 75:6-7).

questions.question: What did Uzziah build to strengthen Jerusalem’s defenses?
questions.explanation: Verse 9 reveals Uzziah’s construction of towers and fortifications, symbolizing divine provision for security (Nehemiah 4:6).

questions.question: What agricultural activity did Uzziah love and promote?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:10 highlights Uzziah's love for husbandry, reflecting stewardship of creation and God’s provision through the land (Genesis 2:15).

questions.question: How large was Uzziah’s army according to the chapter?
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 state the army numbered three hundred thousand and seven thousand five hundred, showing God’s blessing in military strength (2 Samuel 10:6).

questions.question: What military equipment did Uzziah provide for his army?
options: Shields, spears, helmets, habergeons, bows, and slings
questions.correctAnswer: Shields, spears, helmets, habergeons, bows, and slings
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:14 lists these armaments, indicating preparation and wisdom in leadership, paralleling Paul's exhortation to put on the full armor of God (Ephesians 6:11).

questions.question: What was the consequence of Uzziah’s pride and transgression against God?
options: He was blessed with more power
questions.explanation: Verse 16-19 describe how Uzziah’s pride led to leprosy, illustrating the biblical truth that sin separates from God and leads to judgment (Numbers 12:9-10, 2 Kings 5:27).

questions.question: Who opposed Uzziah when he attempted to burn incense in the temple?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:17-18 records Azariah and 80 priests confronting Uzziah, emphasizing the holiness of God’s worship and proper priestly roles (Leviticus 10:1-2, Hebrews 7:26-27).

questions.question: How long did Uzziah remain a leper and where did he dwell after his affliction?
options: Until his death, in a separate house
For a year, in the palace
For a month, in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Until his death, in a separate house
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 26:21 states Uzziah was a leper until death and lived separately, reflecting God's holiness and the consequences of disobedience (Leviticus 13:45-46).

questions.question: Who took over the governance of the king's house and judging the people when Uzziah was afflicted?
questions.explanation: Verse 21 reveals that Jotham, Uzziah’s son, governed during his father’s leprosy, illustrating God’s provision for continuity in leadership (2 Kings 15:5).
